name: Andrew Hamil
bio:
Andrew R. Hamil is the President of Hamil Trust Consulting, LLC. Prior to founding the firm, Mr. Hamil was the President of Wealth Enhancement Trust Services, LLC, an affiliate of Wealth Enhancement Group, one of the largest Registered Investment Advisors in the country. Mr. Hamil is also the former President and Chairman of Fidelity Personal Trust Company, FSB. In this role he was responsible for overseeing Fidelity’s personal trust solutions and services. Mr. Hamil joined Fidelity in 2012 as the National Manager of their Trust & Estate Consulting Group and later served as the co-head of Fidelity’s Family Engagement and Aging Investor strategy. In this role Mr. Hamil helped lead a cross-company effort that addressed complex multi-generational planning issues facing clients and their families.

Prior to Fidelity, Mr. Hamil was with Bank of America serving in a variety of leadership roles responsible for providing legal and risk management support to Trust officers and Portfolio Managers across the firm’s Northeast footprint. Prior to Bank of America, Mr. Hamil was in private legal practice in Boston, Massachusetts.

Mr. Hamil received a bachelor’s degree in history from Old Dominion University and his Juris Doctorate from Suffolk University Law School in Boston. He is also a Certified Senior Advisor®. Mr. Hamil is married with three wonderful children. He resides in East Greenwich, Rhode Island.

name: Docupace
bio: Docupace is a solutions provider focused on digitizing and automating operations in the financial advice and investment industry. Financial services firms use the Docupace Platform (a cloud-based, integrated software suite) to reduce back-office expenses, improve efficiency, strengthen recruiting, and enhance the experience of advisors and investors. With headquarters in Holmdel, New Jersey, Docupace is proud to serve some of the largest independent broker-dealers and registered investment advisers (RIAs) in the financial services industry. For more information, please visit www.docupace.com.

name: Bryan Repple
bio:
Bryan is the founder of Repple Wealth Group. The focus of Repple Wealth Group is to provide clients the answer to the four most difficult financial questions challenging families today. Understanding these answers will help lead families to a more secure financial future.

He also serves as CEO of Repple Insurance Services, an independent Insurance Organization providing training, support, and products to Independent Financial and Insurance advisors on Estate, Tax, and Wealth Accumulation strategies. Learn more here.

name: Carmine Corino
bio:
Carmine is the Founder and CEO of Cornerstone Planning Group, an Independent Advisory Firm. Since 2003, he’s been in the Financial Services industry focused on delivering massive value for his clientele.

Carmine has developed a practice over many years that focuses solely on the needs of its clients, always having their back, and acting in their best interests without any conflicts of interest. As the business grew, so did the need to bring on like-minded advisors to help. Learn more here.

name: Brendon Murphy
bio:
As the CEO and President of Compass Financial Solutions Inc., in Havertown, PA, I provide professional expertise in Long Term Care, Business Insurance, Life Insurance, and Personal Pension Fixed Annuities products. I’ve been helping families, individuals and business owners secure financial peace of mind since 2013.

At Compass Financial Solutions Inc., I currently service individuals, families and businesses throughout the Greater Philadelphia Region, New Jersey, Delaware, North Carolina, Las Vegas, and Georgia.

I live in Springfield, Delaware County, PA with my wife Kristen and our two sons, Evan, and Preston. In my spare time, I serve as a member of the Board of the Springfield Youth Club. I am also a proud sponsor of the F.O.P. Lodge 27, the Collingdale Fire Company, the Delco Group, and the Tunnels to Towers Foundation. Today, more than ever, successful financial and retirement planning takes a team of professionals who are knowledgeable and ready to assist you in growing, protecting, and optimizing your assets. Let’s have a conversation. Learn more here.

name: One Wealth Management
bio: One Wealth Management is an Independent Financial Services firm, whose representatives have a combined 100+ years of industry experience coupled with a futuristic point of view. Our firm provides unparalleled guidance and service to those clients that want to grow, protect and enhance their legacies. One Wealth Management guides our clients with foresight and advance planning techniques and services to enhance one of the most important relationships in our clients’ lives. Learn more here.

name: Brent Mekosh
bio:
Brent’s passion lies in deeply understanding the core values of his clients and guiding them to achieve more than they could have ever imagined. Since his first stock investment at the age of 12, financial planning and wealth management have been an integral part of Brent’s life. After graduating with a B.S. in Finance from the University of Colorado at Boulder in 1995, Brent went to work in New York City on the trading floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) with a predecessor firm of Bear Wagner Specialists. During that time, he quickly rose to become Vice President of trading and a member of the NYSE. After trading hours, he earned an MBA in Finance and International Business from New York University.

In 2006, Brent embarked on a year-long backpacking adventure across Africa, India, Australia, and Southeast Asia, and North America. This journey not only broadened his perspective on life, but also deepened his understanding of diverse cultures and economic systems. Settling in Arizona, he joined Raymond James in 2007, committed to building a practice focused on the financial well-being of his clients. In 2024, Brent partnered with his long-time friend Jeff Breese at the Wealth Stewards.

Brent is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ Professional, Certified Exit Planning Advisor® and Certified Investment Management Analyst®, holding the Series 4,7,24,31,51,63 and 65 licenses. His commitment to the community is evident through his membership in Valley Estate Planners and his participation in Scottsdale Leadership, Class XXIV. Learn more here.

name: Kevin Ruth
bio:
Kevin Ruth is the founder and creator of the Give-Get® financial planning game that teaches players basic financial concepts. Players go on money journeys where they give money to try to get money to grow their net worth. Kevin believes everyone should have access to basic financial education. With 30 years in the financial services industry, Kevin has led Private Wealth and Financial Planning teams at Merrill Lynch, UBS Financial Services, Fidelity Investments, and Raymond James.

At Fidelity, Kevin served as the first Chief Financial Planning Officer for Fidelity Personal and Workplace Advisors and served as the Chair for Fidelity Personal Trust Company. At UBS, Kevin was the Chair and CEO of UBS Trust Company, the president of UBS Financial Services Insurance Agency, and served on the board of the UBS Puerto Rico Family of Funds. Kevin is a Commissioner for the CFP® Board's Standards Resource Commission and is a Board Member for Signature Financial Services Group.

Kevin served four years in the U.S. Army. Since leaving the military, Kevin has supported non-profit Veteran-focused organizations and is on the Board of The Patriot Fund, a tax-exempt charitable organization that supports our Veterans and their families. In addition to his professional experience, Kevin holds a Bachelor of Science degree from the United States Military Academy at West Point and a Master of Science degree from The American College.

Kevin is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER®, Chartered Life Underwriter, Chartered Financial Consultant, Chartered Advisor in Philanthropy, and Accredited Estate Planner. Learn more here.

name: Dennis Oâ€™Keefe
bio: Dennis knew what he wanted to do with his life from junior year in high school. His desire to become a financial planner led him to a Finance degree from Bentley University. For the last 30 years, he has worked with individuals preparing for retirement.  He has taught thousands and held the hands of literally hundreds during the often-difficult process of retiring. Dennis holds his CFP® designation and has been seen in publications such as The Boston Globe, Yahoo Finance and Business Insider. Learn more here.

name: Nicholas St. George
bio: I have the privilege of overseeing and coordinating the financial futures of a select group of families, individuals and business owners. My passion lies in crafting personalized financial plans that empower you to define and achieve your goals. Whether it's building a robust budget, planning for retirement, or ensuring your investments reflect your aspirations, I'm here to guide you every step of the way. Clients often tell me that what sets me apart isn't just my comprehensive financial acumen but also my approachable and warm personality. Standing tall, I bring a sense of stability and trustworthiness to every meeting. I like to say that I must be honest because I’m too slow to run and too big to hide—a little humor to lighten our discussions on serious financial matters. Learn more here.

name: Larry Sprung
bio: Larry Sprung is an award-winning Founder & Wealth Advisor based in Hauppauge, New York with 26 years of experience in the field. I am a husband, father, entrepreneur, author, and mental health advocate. I founded Mitlin Financial, Inc., in 2004 with a focus on prioritizing the families we serve. The Mitlin team consistently helps those families make healthy financial decisions and offers an exceptional experience that leverages personalized service with today’s top tools and technology. We strive to help you achieve your goals while finding JOY in the journey! Learn more here.

name: John Soutsos
bio:
John Soutsos is one of IPC's most senior professionals with over 35 years of experience. John has been providing professional wealth management services since 1986 and his team serves a select number of high net worth families. He graduated from York University in 1985 with a Bachelor of Arts, majoring in Economics. He worked with a major Canadian bank for two years prior to opening his practice.

His primary role is the day-to-day management of his Med-Wealth Defensive Growth model portfolio which is a core component of each of his various asset-allocation models that range from 50% to 100% stocks. Med-Wealth Defensive Growth is a concentrated U.S. stock portfolio designed to enhance overall returns using his ‘Portfolio Boost’ strategy. Learn more here.

name: Aaron Buchner
bio: Aaron has a vision - to revolutionize the way people perceive their finances, transforming it from a tedious chore to an exciting part of their life's journey. His approach is refreshingly unconventional, taking traditional financial services and infusing them with innovation and fun. At the heart of his work is a passion to help real people overcome real financial challenges, empowering them to take control and sculpt their financial future. Welcome to the new era of financial planning, the Aaron Buchner way. Learn more here.

name: Dan Reese
bio: Dan Reese is a Founder, Senior Wealth Advisor based in Jackson, Michigan with 24 years of experience in the field. He has worked with families since 2001 to develop prudent strategies in pursuit of long-term financial success. Taking a comprehensive approach, Dan focuses on each of the areas of wealth management including making smart choices with money, mitigating taxes, taking care of heirs, protecting assets from being unjustly taken through litigation or divorce, and charitable giving. Learn more here.

name: Mike Mathweg
bio: Mike Mathweg is a seasoned entrepreneur and founder of Relentless Consulting, where he helps insurance agency owners structure, scale, and sell their businesses. After being fired from a corporate job, Mike discovered his entrepreneurial spirit and entered and exited the insurance industry for multiple millions before age 30. Drawing from his own journey of transformation, including becoming an Eagle Scout and named to the 40 Under 40 Class of 2024 by In Business Magazine, Mike now mentors agency owners to achieve both financial success and lifestyle freedom. His direct, no-nonsense approach emphasizes self-determination and relentless pursuit of goals while maintaining work-life balance. Learn more here and here.

name: Lakesha Williams
bio: Lakesha Williams is a Wealth Strategist, Financial Literacy Advocate, Speaker and Chief Empowerment Officer at FinEd platform Dear Lakesha. Equipped with an MBA and more than 20 years of experience in the banking industry specializing in wealth management, she’s on a mission to empower and educate women seeking financial freedom and security. From investment and savings plans to divorce recovery tools, Dear Lakesha provides the insights women need to navigate their financial journey with clarity. Learn more here.

name: James Cantwell
bio: With over two decades of experience in wealth management technology, James Cantwell has fundamentally shaped how investment firms embrace and leverage digital innovation. His hands-on experience transforming hundreds of RIAs and family offices has made him a trusted voice in technology strategy and operational excellence. Known for his ability to bridge the gap between traditional investment management and cutting-edge technology solutions, James has developed a unique methodology for helping firms navigate their digital evolution. His current ventures reflect his passion for solving industry-wide challenges – from optimizing operational workflows to reimagining how firms evaluate and select technology partners. As a thought leader and innovator, James continues to influence how the wealth management industry approaches technological advancement and operational efficiency. Learn more here.

name: Elysabeth Alfano
bio:
Elysabeth Alfano is the CEO of VegTech™ Invest, the Advisor to the VegTech™ sustainable food innovation ETF.

Elysabeth is an expert in investing in food systems transformation and speaks internationally on the intersection of investing, sustainability, and our global food supply system.  She has spoken at the U.N. Global Leaders Compact Summit, the United Nations Climate Change Summit, COP27 and COP28, Yale University and Northwestern University, several Bloomberg Intelligence events and done a myriad of TV interviews. 

Elysabeth began her career with Kellogg Company working on Special K and Frosted Mini-Wheats before acting as Chief Investment Officer for a small family office. A graduate of Northwestern University and the Thunderbird School of Global Management, Elysabeth consults and advises, through her consulting company, C-Suite Executives on the sustainable food industry landscape, growth strategies, and whitespaces.  

Lastly, Elysabeth hosts the Plantbased Business Hour, a podcast which features the CEOs and business leaders in the food innovation sector.  The Plantbased Business Hour is considered “The Gold Standard” for those who want to understand, participate in, and capitalize on the growing industry.  She also hosts the Upside & Impact: Investing for Change podcast featured on this publication.

Elysabeth contributes to ESG Clarity, WGN Radio, Vegconomist Magazine, CAIA, ETFCentral.com, FactSet Insights and Advisorpedia.

CEO: VegTech™ Invest, Advisor to the VegTech™ Plant-based Innovation & Climate ETF, EATV

Host: Upside & Impact: Investing for Change (on the New York Stock Exchange platform, ETFCentral.com)

Contributor: ESG Clarity, ESG Investor, Vegconomist, WGN-TV, NPR, FinTechTV, CAIA, FactSet

Sustainability Events Chair: Women in ETFs (WE)

Connect with her on Linkedin. Sign on to our Protein Diversification & Disclosures Stakeholder Engagement.

Download a free copy of the Top 5 Best Practices for Stakeholder Engagement in Plant-based Innovation & Diversified Proteins

name: Asset Advisory Services
bio:
Asset Advisory Services is a full-service financial planning firm located in Jupiter, FL. The company provides a comprehensive range of financial services, including investment management, retirement planning, estate planning, tax planning, and insurance coverage, to help clients reach their financial goals. With a focus on personalized service and advice, Asset Advisory Services has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals and families in the Jupiter area.

At Asset Advisory Services, our team of experienced financial advisors takes a holistic approach to financial planning. We begin by getting to know each client, understanding their unique financial situation and goals, and helping them develop a comprehensive financial plan that is tailored to their specific needs. Our financial advisors then provide ongoing guidance and support, helping clients implement their financial plan and make informed decisions about their investments and other financial matters. Learn more here.

name: Jeff Thorsteinson
bio:
Jeff helps advisors break through the chaos and build thriving, profitable practices. The financial advisory world is tougher than ever. Independent and institutional advisors are drowning in regulatory reform, administrative headaches, and rising client expectations. It’s a perfect storm, leaving little time for growth or clarity on where to focus.

That’s where he comes in. His zone of genius is helping advisors like you achieve clarity, process, systems, efficiency, and laser-focused success. With a wealth of over 30 years of industry experience, Jeff has been a trusted provider of marketing and practice management services to financial advisors worldwide.

Jeff has been a driving force in the financial industry for nearly three decades, having co-founded and operated The Newsletter Factory and the YouFoundation. These firms, which exclusively served financial advisors, investment dealers, mutual funds, and insurance companies, are a testament to his entrepreneurial spirit. He has successfully completed many thousands of marketing and practice management projects throughout his career.

Jeff has also managed his own successful advisor practice.  He has witnessed firsthand the challenges independent advisors and dealers face as they struggle to create effective practices, compete with larger financial institutions, and deliver more value for clients. Knowing there was a better way, Jeff co-founded Agora Wealth and Agora Dealer Services in Canada– offering a unique wealth platform that integrates modern technology, business and investment operations, and custody services that tackle the biggest pain points facing advisors. Agora brought the Turnkey Asset Management Platform to Canada, becoming a big growth area of wealth management for the firm.

Today, Jeff is focused on helping investment dealers and advisors enhance their visibility and deliver value in the marketplace. He works directly with them to articulate their value, systemize their business, and capture their biggest opportunities. Learn more here.

name: Jason Mirabella
bio:
Jason Mirabella is the founder of Deliver Advice. With over 24 years in the financial services industry, Jason has extensive experience in strategic operations, platform management, and wealth management. Jason has been involved in key mergers and acquisitions with firms like WealthSource Partners, Model FA, and SurePath Wealth Management.

As a former C-suite executive at WealthSource Partners, he managed strategic operations for a firm with over $2B in AUM. Jason has also held leadership roles at SurePath Wealth Management and Model FA, focusing on platform development and business growth. He founded Henfruit, LLC, a virtual financial planning firm acquired after three years, and served as Director of Research & Analytics at Partners Wealth Management. Learn more here.

name: Zac Amos
bio: Zac Amos is the Features Editor at ReHack Magazine with bylines on AllBusiness, Forbes, and e27. He specializes in covering business tech, cybersecurity, and compliance. For more of his work, follow him on LinkedIn or X (Twitter).

name: Why The Buzz
bio: Why The Buzz? explores the success stories behind today’s most exciting companies. Our hosts break down the key factors driving their growth, offering insights rooted in deep market experience and a keen understanding of business dynamics. Investors will gain valuable takeaways from these conversations as Chris Versace, Bob Lang, Lindsey Bell, and their expert guests delve into who these companies are, what they do, and why they matter in today’s world.

name: Mark Abssy
bio:
Mark Abssy is the Head of Indexing at Tematica Research focused on index and ETP development as well as the Tematica Model Suite and supporting collateral. Since his start in 1995, he has held product development and management positions at All You Can ETF, NYSE|ICE, ISE ETF Ventures, Morgan Stanley, Fidelity Investments, and Loomis Sayles. Since 2008 Mark’s focus has been on the index and ETF space where he has been at the forefront of thematic ETFs with the development of the indexes that powered funds like FAN, HACK, SKYY, IPAY, GAMR, and YYY among others.

Mark has been quoted, interviewed, and a contributor to numerous publications over the years, including Bloomberg, Schaeffer’s Sentiment, John Lothian News, The Journal of Indexes, Swiss Derivatives Review, Nasdaq.com, TheStreet.com, ETF.com, All You Can ETF, and Tematica Research. Connect with him here.

name: Dana Klein
bio: Dana Klein has over thirty years of extensive experience selling and marketing financial products and programs that give advisors and their clients an edge. He is highly regarded for inventive programs and presentations that provide life skills with specific strategies and tactics anyone can employ in the work and home lives. He has been a globally sought after speaker and consultant, known for interpreting complex academic concepts and ideas turning them into accessible action steps. Dana is a founding member of the Cialdini Institute, and a Cialdini Certified Coach in the science of ethical persuasion. Connect with him on LinkedIn.

name: Monika Jansen
bio: Monika is Head Kick-Ass Copywriter and Strategist at her content marketing agency, Jansen Communications. She has more than 15 years of experience helping companies grow by generating leads. Specifically, she does this by creating the right messages for the right people on the right channels at the right time. Our agency’s services include blogging, email marketing, website content, social media marketing, and marketing copy for things like presentations and white papers – the stuff you need for generating leads. When she’s not working with clients, she can be found in her beloved adopted state of Colorado, hiking, snowboarding, going to concerts, walking the dog, and hanging out with family and friends. Connect with her on LinkedIn. Learn more here.

name: Loretta Kilday
bio: Attorney Loretta Kilday has over 36 years of litigation and transactional experience, specializing in business, collection, and family law. She frequently writes on various financial and legal matters. She is a graduate of DePaul University with a Juris Doctor degree and a spokesperson for Debt Consolidation Care (DebtCC) online debt relief forum. Please connect with her on LinkedIn for further information.

name: Stephen Kates
bio: Stephen Kates is a CFP® professional and personal finance expert specializing in financial planning and education. He serves as Principal Financial Analyst for RetireGuide.com, providing strategic insights on wealth management, retirement planning, and investing. Stephen is the Founder of Clocktower Financial Consulting, LLC, and was previously the Head of Financial Planning for Advisor.com. With over 15 years of experience in the financial industry, Stephen focuses on creating targeted consumer finance solutions for individuals, families, and business owners. He leverages his passion for financial literacy to simplify complex topics and make financial planning accessible to everyone. Please connect with Stephen here.

name: Walter Valenzuela
bio:
Walter Valenzuela, Co-CEO of Tidewater Financial, brings nearly 30 years of dedicated service in the financial industry. A proud San Diego State University alumnus, Walter's career includes top positions at ML Stern, Southwest Securities, and Hilltop Securities.

In 2019, Walter, along with Co-CEO Justin Parker, founded Tidewater Financial in Encinitas, California. The firm excels in wealth management with a specialization in Tax-Free Municipal Bonds, providing expert financial advising and tax strategies to help clients achieve their financial goals.

Walter's approach, grounded in integrity and client success, has earned him a stellar reputation. Tidewater Financial combines over 55 years of expertise, offering tax-efficient investment choices and robust financial planning. They are your trusted partners in wealth management and fixed income strategies. Learn more here.

name: Craig Israelsen
bio:
Dr. Israelsen holds a Ph.D. in Family Resource Management from Brigham Young University.  He received a B.S. in Agribusiness and a M.S. in Agricultural Economics from Utah State University. 

He taught at Brigham Young University for 9 years and at the University of Missouri-Columbia for 14 years.   He now teaches as an Executive-in-Residence at Utah Valley University in the Personal Financial Planning Program.  He currently serves on several investment committees (My529 and Health Equity Advisors). Primary among his research interests is the analysis of mutual funds and the design of investment portfolios.  He wrote monthly for Financial Planning Magazine for over 20 years and now is a regular contributor to Horsesmouth.com, Better Investing Magazine, and the AAII Journal.  His research has also been published in the Journal of Financial Planning, Journal of Asset Management (U.K.), Journal of Performance Measurement, and the Asia Financial Planning Journal (Singapore).

His research has been cited in the Christian Science Monitor, Wall Street Journal, Newsweek, Forbes, Smart Money Magazine, Kiplinger Retirement Report, Advisor Perspectives, Dow Jones Market Watch, Family Circle Magazine, and Bottom Line Personal. Dr. Israelsen is also the developer of the 7Twelve Portfolio (www.7TwelvePortfolio.com) and the author of three books.  His most recent book is titled “7Twelve:  A Diversified Investment Portfolio with a Plan” (John Wiley & Sons, 2010).

name: Bob Lang
bio: Bob Lang is one of the country’s top technical analysts, expert options trader, sought-after mentor and teacher, and popular speaker at industry conferences and tradeshows. He launched Explosive Options with one membership offering: his signature directional trading service. Members receive real-time trade ideas based on what he’s doing for his own portfolio and private clients. Because Bob is always looking for new opportunities, his suite of offerings has grown to include a chat room and a spread trading service, which is managed by Sam DeMarco. Bob is also a private trader in equity and option markets at his other company, Aztec Capital LLC. Learn more here.

name: What Does It Mean?
bio: The What Does It Mean? podcast breaks down key items impacting the stock market and the economy, keeping listeners updated and positioned to make smarter investing decisions. The podcast leverages multi-disciplinary insights across fundamental, technical, and thematic investing strategies with two helping scoopfuls of context and perspective. Chris Versace, Lindsey Bell, and their guests give their (often) varying perspectives, contributing to engaging and informative discussions.

name: Lindsey Bell
bio: Lindsey Bell is a thought leader, public speaker and award winner, best known for the unique insights she shares about financial markets. As Chief Investment Strategist at 248 Ventures, she provides insights and guidance on equity market investing strategies for institutional clients, advisors and high net-worth clients. She also studies the changing dynamics of work and shares her thought-provoking ideas on the topic through her newsletter, The Shift. Bell’s unique ability to connect the dots between data and real life stems from her deep background as a chief investment strategist, analyst, researcher and portfolio manager at organizations including Ally, J.P. Morgan, Deutsche Bank and S&P Global (CFRA Research). She is a BetterInvesting board member, which is a non-profit that helps create investment clubs to teach individual investors how to become successful long-term investors. Finally, Bell was named as one of American Banker’s Most Powerful Women in Banking: Next 2021 and is an honoree of the 2020 Investment News 40 Under 40. Bell graduated from the University of Pittsburgh. Connect with her on LinkedIn.

name: Chris Battaglia
bio:
With decades of experience working with institutional investors and asset management companies, I launched Pareto Global Partners to focus on the needs of these important investors who are seeking to expand their portfolios, grow their assets, and find suitable distribution partners to satisfy their strategic growth initiatives. Currently, I am working with a select group of clients who are seeking capital from institutional investors, family offices, insurance companies, and other accredited investors in a variety of sectors and strategies. Pareto Global Partners can assist clients in the following areas:

Asset raising
Distribution
Asia/Europe expansion
Marketing/Strategic Planning
Branding/Communication
Content development

Connect with me on LinkedIn

name: Matthew Paine
bio: LifeCap Holdings, LLC is a firm that works with institutions and family offices providing bespoke longevity-oriented investment structures. As the co-founder and managing director, I leverage my 24+ years of experience in the financial and insurance industry to create innovative and profitable solutions for our clients. I have a deep expertise in secondary market for life insurance, an alternative asset class that offers attractive returns and low correlation with traditional markets. Learn more here.

name: David Conti
bio: David Conti, CPRC, is a N.H.-based financial writer and retirement coach. His work on personal finance, retirement, and wealth management topics has appeared in FORBES, MarketWatch, The Street, Kiplinger, Motley Fool, and Fidelity Wealth Management. He is a graduate of the Boston College School of Management and is founder of RetireMentors, a retirement transition coaching and consulting firm. Contact him on LinkedIn.

name: Steve Sosnick
bio: Steve Sosnick is the Chief Strategist at Interactive Brokers (IBKR), which provides online trade execution and clearing services to institutional, professional and individual investors for a wide variety of electronically traded products including stocks, options, futures, forex, bonds, and funds worldwide. Learn more here.

name: Schwab Independent Branch Services
bio: From the beginning, Schwab has championed investors and the financial advisors who serve them. The Schwab franchise model continues that tradition. The concept is simple: You own your own franchise business while Schwab provides you with an infrastructure and access to an extensive range of wealth management solutions, services, and tools plus a robust bench of support resources to help you pursue your goals as an entrepreneur. Learn more here.

name: Ari Galper
bio:
Ari Galper is the number one authority on trust-based selling.

In today’s over-marketed and commoditized world, Ari has defined the state of selling in today's economy as the “Trust Recession”.

You know you’re in the Trust Recession if you're doing free consulting, using "value" to sell and chasing your prospects... only to then hear: "I'd like to think about it."

Learn how to collapse your long sales cycle into a very short one and save yourself precious time.

In Ari's first best-selling book, "Unlock The Sales Game", he describes his revolutionary sales approach based on getting to the truth and why shifting your mindset to deep trust, instead of “the sale” – ironically, can double your sales.

His second most popular book, "Trusted Authority", explains how to position yourself as a "category-of-one" to your market, creating inbound scheduled appointments, and having clients pursuing you -- instead of you pursuing them.

Ari's latest book, "TRUST - In A Split Second", reveals the psychological and behavioral triggers you need to know to prevent potential clients from delaying their decision to hire you.

In "Are You Chasing Ghosts"? -- this breakthrough book finally solves the never-ending persistent problem of chasing leads who don't call you back.

You'll never again have to hear: "I'll get back to you when I'm ready", "I can't make a decision" and "I'll think about it."

"The One Call Sale" (patent pending), provides a clear road map to collapse your sales cycle into one simple conversation... no pressure, no closing and no follow-up.

Everything you learned about selling will be turned upside down.

Ari is also the author of "Lessons From Toby", a special book about his son Toby who has Down Syndrome, who has made a major impact on Ari's approach to teaching authenticity and trust in his Trust-Based Selling approach, learn more at: TobysBook.com.

Ari was recently interviewed by Kevin Harrington from "Shark Tank", was a featured speaker at the Financial Planning Association annual conference, and is a member of Vistage.

Get Ari’s 6 best-selling books for FREE here and you’ll also receive a Complimentary Sales and Lead Generation Consultation (value $995.00). Connect with Ari on LinkedIn. Learn more here.

name: JosÃ© Torres
bio: José Torres is Senior Economist at Interactive Brokers. In this capacity, he is responsible for economic analysis, economic commentary and educational content focused on the economy. Prior to joining Interactive Brokers, José spent 6 years working as an economist in the United States government within the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). During his time with the U.S. government, José frequently led presentations covering economic conditions and forecasts for elected officials, political appointees and senior management. He also built economic models, consulted with private sector executives, contributed to the modernization of economic processes and gained recognition for predicting the inflationary episode of the 2020s. José has also been a professor of economics at the City University of New York and holds a master’s degree in financial economics from West Texas A&M University. His skillset includes the ability to communicate and analyze complex economic topics in English and in Spanish and throughout his career, he has been interviewed by media outlets including Bloomberg, CNBC, CNN, WSJ, AP, Yahoo Finance, Cheddar, Business Insider, Seeking Alpha, PBS, FOX, Economic Times, Univision, Telemundo and others. Learn more here.

name: John and Alex Soutsos
bio:
We have extensive experience and market intelligence in the high net worth and mass affluent markets, we have our finger on the pulse of what you want when it comes to your portfolios. That’s why we bring you the simplicity of a non-discretionary portfolio with the benefits of personalized, extra-focussed attention to make sure you are reaching your goal. All at an entry point of $250,000 per household!

The benefits of IPC’s Private Wealth Portfolios include a simplified, single portfolio that is well diversified and optimized; a strong roster of carefully researched and selected investment specialists; a dedicated portfolio management team; and, of course, high levels of customized service and advice to take you right to you goals! Learn more here.

name: Kristin Harad
bio: On a mission to enable self-driven financial freedom, Kristin inspires independent financial planners and advisors to succeed as entrepreneurs.  Leading by example Kristin demonstrates how to embrace challenge, manage anxiety, develop systems, and navigate the busy world to achieve entrepreneurial success and live the life you desire. Kristin believes that as independent advisors flourish, so do their clients, opening up a world where anxiety can quietly buzz in the background of a full, energized, and free life. Learn more here.

name: Suzanne Schmitt
bio:
Suzanne Schmitt serves as NextChapter Managing Director, leading growth strategies employing longevity planning and financial wellness. Prior to joining Next Chapter, Suzanne served as Head of Financial Wellness for New York Life. In this capacity, she built the firm’s first holistic financial wellbeing strategy; delivered a comprehensive hybrid user experience including products, services and solutions as well as access to human advice and guidance; developed the vendor and partner slate; built the bench by bringing together top internal and external talent; and launched this differentiated capability in under a year. Suzanne also served as media spokesperson on a range of topics including financial wellbeing, women and wellness, and caregiving.

Suzanne holds a BA in psychology and communications from Douglass College. She also holds an MA in organizational development and leadership, as well as a certificate in servant leadership, from Gonzaga University. Suzanne has certificates in gerontology and elder abuse prevention from the University of Southern California. Suzanne also has a patent for calculating health and wealth outcomes from the United States Patent Office. Learn more here.

name: Terry Wheeler
bio:
Terry is a highly accomplished Estate and Wealth Strategist Planner brimming with experience. He is an Estate Planning Attorney and taught tax at the University of California, Davis. His career in the financial industry began in 1987, underpinned by a strong educational foundation. Terry holds a Bachelor's degree in Financial Planning from San Diego State University and a Juris Doctorate Degree in Law from the University of the Pacific McGeorge School of Law. He furthered his studies with a post-doctorate program at the Masters program of the Esperti Peterson Institute.

Terry is nationally recognized for his expertise in wealth accumulation, preservation, estate planning, charitable planning, and asset protection. He frequently educates attorneys, accountants, and financial professionals through lectures and writings on these subjects. He also authored various articles and presentations.

He is affiliated with esteemed organizations like the American Bar Association, the Estate and Probate Section of the Sacramento Country Bar, the Financial Planning Association, the National Association of Enrolled Agents, Wealth Counsel, and the National Network of Estate Planning Attorneys. Terry holds law licenses in California and the United States Eastern District of California, in addition to being a Certified Financial Planner. Learn more here.

name: Hamilton Lane
bio: Hamilton Lane (Nasdaq: HLNE) is one of the largest private markets investment firms globally, providing innovative solutions to institutional and private wealth investors around the world. Dedicated exclusively to private markets investing for more than 30 years, the firm currently employs nearly 700 professionals operating in offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Hamilton Lane has $902.8 billion in assets under management and supervision, composed of $120.0 billion in discretionary assets and $782.9 billion in non-discretionary assets, as of December 31, 2023. Hamilton Lane specializes in building flexible investment programs that provide clients access to the full spectrum of private markets strategies, sectors and geographies. Learn more here.

name: Matson Money
bio: Matson Money, Inc. "Matson" is a federally Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) with the Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) founded in 1991 by Mark Matson. Matson is a $9.8 billion in assets under management (as of 02.5.2024) wealth management and advisor coaching firm providing outsourced investment management and education to independent advisors and their clients across North America. During our educational event, the American Dream Experience®, we train and develop participants to discover their True Purpose for Money® and help create a long-term investing strategy based on academic investing principles. As a team, we are out to revolutionize the financial industry. Learn more here.

name: WisdomTree
bio:
In 2006, WisdomTree launched with a big idea and an impressive mission — to create a better way to invest. We believed investors shouldn’t have to choose between cost efficiency and performance potential, so we developed the first family of ETFs designed to deliver both.

Today, WisdomTree offers a leading product range that offers access to an unparalleled selection of unique and smart exposures. Learn more here.

name: The Family Financial Conversation
bio: Hosted by Tom West, The Family Financial Conversation is a podcast about the decisions families make as they age that involve money, but might revolve around very different things. Listen in to hear thoughts from industry professionals on getting the best possible outcomes from those decisions through the lens of great financial advice. To be a guest please contact Jakie Beard.

name: Jerry Goodman
bio:
Jerry Goodman began his career as a financial consultant in 1982 and has also served as branch manager of the Knoxville office of Wachovia Securities, a predecessor firm of Wells Fargo Advisors. In 1998, he completed coursework from the College of Financial Planning to become a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™. To earn this certification a candidate must meet requirements involving education, experience and ethical standards, as well as successful completion of a comprehensive exam.

Jerry is the author of The Widow’s Digest, a guide covering 37 counties in East Tennessee, and also conducts estate planning workshops to help attendees with the goal of helping them with organizing their affairs.

Jerry is currently the managing principal of Goodman & Hubbard, an investment group under the name of TN Wealth Management. He’s a graduate of the University of Tennessee with a degree in accounting, he previously served on the professional staff of Price Waterhouse and was the Comptroller of Wendy’s of Knoxville. Learn more here.

name: Jeff Panik
bio: After almost 20 years’ experience as a financial planner, Jeff Panik knows one of the most valuable roles he plays is to help clients strike a balance between financial obligations and true happiness. Jeff founded Balance Wealth Partners with a simple goal in mind: to create tailored plans for intentional living. Learn more here.

name: Abbey Henderson
bio: In 2001, it was time to follow my dream of being an entrepreneur, and Abaris Financial Group was born .  We’ve since grown from me alone in a small office to a six person staff with over 175 clients. My passion for personal growth started in 2012, when I impulsively decided to attend Jon Kabat-Zinn’s mindfulness program at UMass. It was a life-changing introduction to the power of mindfulness. When I combined mindfulness with the work I did with an amazing coach and a life planner, a new path opened up for me and for my work at Abaris Financial Group. Learn more here.

name: Jason Coddington
bio: Our reasons for becoming financial professionals are deeply personal. We repeatedly saw many friends and family members struggling to find the help they needed to map out their financial future. We are confident that with our understanding of personal finance, coupled with our training as financial professionals, we can help people better prepare for the future. After years in the business, we have developed a reputation for educating individuals in an easy-to-understand manner so they can grasp personal finance and use those concepts to pursue their financial objectives. We feel a commitment to our community. Learn more here.

name: Scott Rothbort
bio:
After spending eight years at Morgan Stanley and Nat West with international assignments in Tokyo, Hong Kong and London, followed by ten years at Merrill Lynch where he managed a derivative trading desk and another six years on international assignments for Morgan Stanley, Scott Rothbort founded LakeView Asset Management, LLC (LVAM) in 2002. LVAM is an Investment Advisor Representative (IAR) associated with the Kingswood USA’s RIA. LVAM has offices in Henderson, NV and Millburn, NJ. Scott, who wholly owns LVAM, is a recognized expert in the financial services industry and appears frequently on CNBC, Bloomberg TV / Radio, Fox Business Network, i24News and local television, and is often quoted in print and online media such as USA Today and Forbes.

Mr. Rothbort was born and raised in Brooklyn, NY. He received an M.B.A., majoring in Finance and International Business from the Stern School of Business, New York University, in 1992, and a B.S. in Economics, majoring in Accounting, from the Wharton School of Business, University of Pennsylvania, in 1982. He is also a graduate of the prestigious Stuyvesant High School in New York City. Mr. Rothbort is married to Layni Horowitz Rothbort, a real estate attorney and together they have five children. They are residents of Henderson, NV and have other homes in Millburn, NJ and Bolton Landing, NY. Scott, along with his business partner, owns South Mountain Stables which races and breed Standardbred horse. Learn more here.

name: Anna Radomska
bio:
Anna's passion for drawing evolved into a fascination with colorful lines and shapes, which later inspired her interest in the stock market. Her academic and early professional life were characterized by intense study and a strong desire to master stock market analysis, as she pursued a career in banking and finance, following her mother’s footsteps.

Gaining recognition in the field, she contributed to industry-leading websites in the USA, Canada, and Great Britain and supported premium trading services at Sunshine Profits.  Anna developed a unique trading system, embodying her belief that being a profitable investor or analyst is a lifelong journey, constantly adapting to the dynamic nature of the markets.

Anna now runs the Oil Trading Alerts for Golden Meadow (formerly Sunshine Profits), which have become reader favorites. Her analyses cover a wide spectrum of the energy sector, ranging from crude oil and natural gas, to uranium companies and green energy. Anna’s unique strength lies in being able to break down the confusing mass of data into easily understood terms.

name: Matt Nelson
bio:
Matt is the Founder and Managing Partner of Perspective 6 Group, and is an Executive Officer of Focus Financial Network, Inc., one of the largest independent firms in Minnesota and the nation.

Matt got his start in the financial industry just two years before the 2000-2002 tech crash. Later, Matt managed investment assets and financial planning services at Wings Financial Federal Credit Union. In 2006, he became an independent financial advisor to better serve his clients.

As a Minneapolis local, his focus is helping Medical Technology industry professionals eliminate their financial stress so they can live with peace of mind, and plan their financial freedom. Learn more here.

name: iCapital
bio:
About iCapital

iCapital powers the world’s alternative investment marketplace offering a complete suite of tools, end-to-end enterprise solutions, data management and distribution capabilities and an innovative operating system. iCapital is the trusted technology partner to independent financial advisors, wealth managers, and asset managers, offering unrivaled access, technology, and education to incorporate alternative assets into the core portfolio strategies for their clients.

At the forefront of the digital transformation in alternative investing, iCapital’s secure platform delivers a complete portfolio of management capabilities for education, transactions, data flows, analytics, and client support throughout the investment lifecycle. With $184.7 billioni in global platform assets, the iCapital operating system automates and streamlines the complex process of private market investing and seamlessly integrates with clients’ existing infrastructure platform and tools.

iCapital employs more than 1,450 people globally, and has 12 offices worldwide including New York, Greenwich, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, and Toronto. iCapital has consistently been recognized for its outstanding innovation, fintech industry leadership, and performance including Forbes Fintech 50 for 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024 and MMI/Barron’s Industry Awards as Solutions Provider of the Year for 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023.

For more information, visit https://icapital.com | Twitter (X): @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc/

name: DeAndre Coke
bio:
DeAndre, a native of Chesapeake, VA, started his practice with Northwestern Mutual in 2011. Since then, he grew a nationwide comprehensive planning practice that covers over 30 states. Early in his career, he developed strong relationships planning for those who serve our country and has come to be known for his specialty in working with Navy SEALs, SWCC, EOD, and other members of the special warfare community.

In 2015, at the age of 25, he was chosen by Inside Business as one of his Region’s Top Forty under 40. In 2016, he was named by Coastal Virginia Magazine as a “Millennial on the Move,” and in 2017, at the age of 27, he was among the youngest advisors in the region to qualify for the Million Dollar Round Table, the premier association of financial professionals worldwide. And in 2023 at the age of 33 he was ranked by Forbes as one of the “Best-In-State Financial Security Professionals”

After 10 years of building his practice and honing in his expertise, he founded Truicity Wealth Management to expand his ability to serve his clients. In addition to running his practice, DeAndre has built his own portfolio or domestic and international investments and has made it a priority to experience traveling around the world at its highest levels.

DeAndre lives in the East Beach section of Norfolk, Virginia, and is a very avid traveler, often visiting numerous countries every year. Because of his passion for community impact, he serves as Vice President on the Board of Directors for the Boys and Girls Club of Southeast Virginia and is also on the board of the organization Guys Doing Good. Learn more here and here.

name: Nathan Yeomans
bio: Nathan serves as the Executive Director and Lead Wealth Advisor of Design Wealth in Englewood, Colorado. Nathan holds his series 66 securities license, health and life insurance license, property and casualty license, long-term care license, and mortgage license. Learn more here.

name: Donald Steinbrugge
bio:
Don is the Founder and CEO of Agecroft Partners, a global hedge fund consulting and marketing firm. Hedgeweek and/or HFM have selected Agecroft Partners 13 years in a row as the Hedge Fund Marketing Firm of the Year.

Don frequently writes white papers on trends he sees in the hedge fund industry. He has spoken at over 100 Alternative Investment conferences, been quoted in hundreds of articles relative to the hedge fund industry, has done over 100 interviews on business television and radio and has over 31,000 subscribers to his Hedge Fund Industry Insights Newsletter.

Don is also the Founder of Gaining the Edge LLC that runs the Hedge Fund Educational Webinar Series, Hedge Fund Leadership Conference and Alternative Investment Cap Intro Events. Over 7000 alternative investment professionals have participated. All profits from these events are donated to charities that benefit at risk children, which have total over $3 million donated since 2013.

Before Agecroft, Don was a founding principal of Andor Capital Management where he was a member of the firm’s Operating Committee. When he left Andor, the firm ranked as the 2nd largest hedge fund firm in the world. Before Andor, Don was Head of Institutional Sales for Merrill Lynch Investment Managers (now part of Blackrock). At that time, MLIM ranked as one of the largest investment managers in the world. Previously, Don was Head of Institutional Sales and on the executive committee for NationsBank Investment Management (now Bank of America).  Learn more here.

name: Niki Clark
bio:
Niki Clark is an accomplished marketing consultant, coach, and specialist for financial advisors. In 2016, she earned her FPQP designation, enhancing her finance knowledge and expertise, which has further helped her support her clients with their marketing.

Having worked in marketing for over 17 years and with hundreds of advisors over the last 8 years, Niki understands how marketing is rapidly changing and is able to adjust in order to serve her clients. In 2023 she officially launched her own company, Niki Clark Marketing, a full-service marketing agency dedicated to helping financial advisors.

As a seasoned strategist and marketing professional, Niki empowers financial advisors with targeted marketing strategies, brand amplification, thought leadership, and business expansion. Her focus is on showcasing the talents and expertise of her clients and being an invaluable resource for financial advisors. Learn more here.

name: Economic Realities
bio: Hosted by Chris Bataglia, Economic Realities was created to bring industry experts together to benefit financial advisors and individuals seeking to improve their financial outcomes. To be a guest please contact Jakie Beard.

name: DAFgiving360
bio: DAFgiving360TM is an independent 501(c)(3) public charity with a mission to increase charitable giving in the U.S. They provide a tax-smart and simple giving solution of a donor-advised fund (DAF) account to donors and financial advisors. Learn more here.

name: Jack Sharry
bio:
Jack has been an “influencer” long before Instagram and TikTok.

Over his distinguished career, he is in daily contact with innovators, leaders, and disruptors who share his passion for combining human and digital advice so consumers achieve financial independence, advisors become more productive, and firms thrive.

Jack is EVP and Chief Growth Officer at LifeYield, a technology company with comprehensive solutions that implement and coordinate tax-efficient investing and tax-smart retirement income planning, including optimizing Social Security benefits.

Jack’s career includes senior leadership roles at Morgan Stanley, Putnam, and Virtus. He contributes to numerous industry boards, publications, and organizations, where he advocates for practices and technology that advances:

- Wider access to financial advice through the convergence of wealth management and workplace benefits.
- Better investor outcomes through comprehensive, household-level financial planning and wealth management.
- Individual retirement security through tax-efficient decumulation planning, Social Security optimization, and annuities.

Jack hosts one of the industry’s most popular podcasts, WealthTech on Deck, attracting over 12,000 listeners and 28,000 downloads. He writes for Advisorpedia, Financial Advisor and InvestmentNews, and is author of the book Authentic and Ethical Persuasion.

Jack is an active volunteer, mentor, and board member, serving as president of the Hale Education board in suburban Boston and as a guest lecturer at Babson College.

name: Kieran Cavanna
bio:
Kieran Cavanna is the Chief Investment Officer and Co-Founder of Old Farm Partners. Prior thereto, Mr. Cavanna worked at Soros Fund Management (“SFM”) from 2013 to 2015 where he served as the Head of the External Manager Selection Team.

Mr. Cavanna and his team performed due diligence on and allocated to a select group of hedge funds that deployed a wide variety of strategies. Within this pool of externally managed capital, a meaningful amount was in co-investments generated by the underlying hedge funds.

At SFM the team sourced, vetted and executed co-investments in equities, global macro and credit instruments. Prior to SFM, Mr. Cavanna was a Partner and the Head of Research at Titan Advisors, a $5b fund-of-hedge funds. Mr. Cavanna has 18+ years of experience allocating to hedge funds. He started his financial career as a senior analyst at KPMG Consulting. Learn more here.

name: Avery Stonestreet
bio: Avery Stonestreet is a digital strategy expert with a focus on corporate brand positioning and development. With experience spanning a decade in the asset and wealth management industry, Avery is specialized in strategically growing brands and marketing multifaceted investment offerings while leveraging innovative trends and tools to optimize business growth. Avery is the Director of Marketing and Digital Strategy at Vident Asset Management. Joining the firm in its start-up years, Avery was pivotal in the launch and distribution of Vident’s suite of ETFs and sub-advisory service. Her tenure has seen her lead marketing compliance, drive rebranding initiatives, and craft growth-centric digital marketing campaigns for a range of investment solutions. Avery earned her Bachelor of Science in Environmental Health Science at the University of Georgia. Connect her on LinkedIn.

name: Eric Blake
bio:
Founder and lead Financial Planner of Blake Wealth Management located in beautiful, historic downtown McKinney, Texas. Over the last 24 years as a financial advisor, I have realized that my true passion is helping women plan for a successful retirement.

On average, women earn 82% of what their male counterparts earn. This often results in lower Social Security and pension benefits, less retirement savings, but a longer average life expectancy. Overcoming the gender pay gap requires better, smarter retirement planning. Maximizing Social Security benefits, minimizing taxes, and investing smarter are critical to living the retirement you deserve.

As you approach retirement, the decisions you need to make can appear intimidating and endless. The aim of our team is to simplify this decision-making process as much as possible. Learn more here.

name: Ryan Poterack
bio:
Ryan Poterack graduated from Iowa State with a degree in Finance. He began his career in management at a Fortune 500 company and quickly realized that, in order to provide his clients with the personalized service and hospitality they deserved, he would need to go out on his own.

He founded Poterack Capital Advisory in 2001 using the tagline “It’s about relationships, not transactions” as his guiding light. Perfecting the client experience is his passion. He has committed his career to creating meaningful relationships with his clients, anchored by candid discussions about real-world choices we all face. Learn more here.

name: Catharine Frick
bio: Catharine Frick is the Founder and CEO of Catnip, an industry-transforming distribution and strategy firm tailored to the intricate demands of the financial services sector.  With over a decade of experience, Catharine has worked with 150+ asset managers. Prior to Catnip, Catharine was the Vice President at Arro Financial Communications, where her transformative approach to communications and marketing strategies showcased her unwavering commitment to innovation. Before that, Catharine was Client Services Director at ETF Trends (VettaFi). Catharine earned her bachelor's degree in Communications at the University of Santa Barbara, California. Learn more here.

name: The Perfect RIA
bio: Micah Shilanski, CFP®, and Matthew Jarvis, CFP® have made every mistake when it comes to prospecting, marketing, delivering massive value, running a team, playing office, and anything else you could do to sabotage success. Long before they met each other via www.Kitces.com/7 & www.Kitces.com/110, they were each deep in debt, hiding under their respective desks, desperately trying to avoid ANOTHER ‘NO!’ from what few prospects they had! Today they are recognized around the world as two of the best ‘lifestyle’ advisors, who, in addition to their own successes with Shilanski and Associates and Jarvis Financial, created The Perfect RIA podcast and coaching program to change the way financial planning is done and help other advisors achieve success through the practice they’ve always dreamed about. Learn more here.

name: David Koren
bio:
As founder and retirement planning specialist at RVA Wealth Management, David focuses on asset protection and growth, helping his clients to manage income flow and enjoy their retirement years. David has worked in the financial services industry in one way or another for over 35 years, starting out as an agent for a national life insurance company while still an undergraduate at Virginia Tech.

â€‹Over his long career – which has included working as an executive for insurance companies, brokerage operations, an internet healthcare startup, and now an independent wealth management firm – David has always focused on education. He considers teaching to be his calling and enjoys educating people on personal finance. David teaches financial education classes in the Richmond area and also offers more in-depth workshops at the office to further explore areas of client interest. Learn more here.

name: John Iannucci
bio: An experienced tax, business succession, and estate planning attorney, John was the director of the estate, retirement, and business planning departments of several law firms in Florida and Pennsylvania before forming ILG Private Wealth. John is passionate about protecting, growing, and successfully transitioning his clients’ wealth. Once clients get to know John, he quickly becomes their most trusted confidante and their go-to resource for anything impacting their families, wealth, and the causes they love. John is a best-selling author and popular speaker. Learn more here.

name: Micheal Heckman
bio:
Mike Heckman is a nationally recognized Financial Educator, Author, Speaker, Retirement planner, and Wealth Advisor.  Mike has been helping business owners, medical professionals, and retirees preserve, protect, and pass on their wealth since 2009. In 2019 Mike founded Sable Point Wealth Management with Michigan office locations in Ludington and Spring Lake. 

Mike is currently conducting dissertation research on wealth preservation strategies in retirement to complete his Financial Management Doctorate from California Southern University. Mike's completed education includes a Master of Science Degree in Financial Planning, including coursework on Behavioral Finance, and a Bachelor of Business Administration in which he studied Business Management and Computer Information Systems. In 2021, Mike earned the Certificate in Blockchain and Digital Assets® from the Digital Assets Council of Financial Professionals and New York Institute of Finance. Mike has been a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ practitioner since 2014.

Mike believes that people make better decisions when they align their goals, values, and actions. Financial advisors who invest in their own education achieve better outcomes for their clients. Learn more here.

name: Laurence Kotlikoff
bio: Larry Kotlikoff is an economics professor at Boston University and President of Economic Security Planning, Inc., which markets MaxiFi Planner PRO and Maximize My Social Security for Professionals -- economics-based financial planning tools for professionals.  Learn more here.

name: David Grau Jr.
bio:
David Grau Jr. is the founder and CEO of Succession Resource Group, a succession and M&A consulting company for advisors. Prior to launching SRG, David was the leading M&A consultant for a well-known succession planning firm to advisors where he led and developed numerous programs for RIAs. Prior to this role, David served in the United States Navy.

David is a published author and accomplished speaker and has been interviewed and cited in dozens of publications over the last decade. He is currently one of the leading speakers in the financial services industry on M&A and next-gen building strategies, with over 200 presentations to his credit. In the past five years, he has spoken at a variety of the industry’s leading firms, including LPL Financial Services, Wells Fargo, Ameriprise Financial, ING, Independent Financial Group, Geneos, Swan Global, Advisor Group, Fidelity, Jackson National, Prudential, Raymond James, and regularly volunteers his time speaking for the Financial Services Institute (FSI) and FPA chapters around the country. Learn more here.

name: Tim Volk
bio:
T. Volk & Company launched as an advisory firm dedicated to helping families flourish. The cornerstone of our work is focused around the five capitals of the family: Human, Intellectual, Social, Spiritual, Financial

Our practice offers customized engagements for clients to help families with a variety of projects:Interviews and assessments, Governance, family committees, and councils Stewardship, ownership, and inheritance. For the advisors, we offer: Strategic planning, Branding and marketing, Enhancing revenue, Client experiences, and Succession planning. Learn more here.

name: Jason Deshayes
bio:
Iâ€¯can simplify the complex and break down complicated problems into a quick task list for us to work on together.â€¯I also avoid getting too much in the weeds—I want to help you, not confuse you.

With my background as a CPA and CFP, I can help balance both your tax and financial planning needs, while keeping the big picture in mind. Learn more here.

name: Brett Ramsay
bio:
Brett is one of our owners and LPL financial advisors here at Artisan Wealth Strategies and has been in the financial industry for 20 years. He specializes in retirement income planning, as well as comprehensive financial planning, and enjoys guiding and supporting his clients through major financial decisions in their lives. 

Brett attended Case Western Reserve University, where he received his undergraduate degree in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering. He went on to attend Duke’s Fuqua School of Business to receive his MBA. While working as an executive at an insurance company, Brett began to realize how much he enjoyed working directly with his clients, and wanted to be able to provide more comprehensive support and guidance to help them pursue their goals. Lern more here.

name: InvestCloud
bio: InvestCloud is transforming the Financial Industry's approach to digital. A single, no-code software platform for both Digital and Commerce enablement within the Financial Industry - covering all aspects of communication, planning, shopping and selling financial products. Cloud-native and multi-tenanted, we are changing how the world’s largest banks, wealth managers and asset managers work – empowering them to leverage and leapfrog decades of technology debt and meet the elevated needs of today’s, and tomorrow’s, end clients. For more information, visit InvestCloud.com or our LinkedIn page.

name: Mark Dorman
bio:
Mark J. Dorman, AIF®, CLU®, ChFC®, CEPA, CFBS has a passion for helping business owners achieve peace of mind. 

It all begins with Mark’s unique ability to uncover a clients true objectives. Understanding what is most important to his clients allows Mark to provide comprehensive planning solutions to address the practical, financial and emotional considerations involved in running a business.

Mark founded Dorman Farrell, LLC in 1999. The financial services and employee benefits company quickly grew into one of the most respected firms in the industry in the state of Ohio. The firm received numerous awards & recognition. Learn more here.

name: Wealth Enhancement Group
bio: Sounds simple, but wealth is complex. It can be difficult to feel confident you’re making all the right choices. Let our team of specialists analyze your wealth from every angle and build a comprehensive custom plan so you can preserve what you’ve built and enjoy what you’ve earned. Simple. Learn more here.

name: Lincoln Financial
bio:
Lincoln Financial helps people confidently plan for their vision of a successful financial future. As of December 31, 2024, approximately 17 million customers trust our guidance and solutions across four core businesses – annuities, life insurance, group protection, and retirement plan services. As of December 31, 2024, the company had $321 billion in end-of-period account balances, net of reinsurance. Headquartered in Radnor, PA., Lincoln Financial is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. 

Learn more at: https://www.lincolnfinancial.com/public/professionals. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram. Sign up for email alerts at http://newsroom.lfg.com.

name: Devin Partida
bio: Devin Partida is the Editor-in-Chief of ReHack.com, and is especially interested in writing about finance and FinTech. Devin's work has been featured on Entrepreneur, Forbes and Nasdaq. Learn more here.

name: Financial Concepts
bio: Help your dreams come true and starting planning today. At Financial Concepts, we provide comprehensive financial planning designed to help you do what's best for you and your family’s future. We'll work with you to review every aspect of your financial life and help you articulate your most important goals. The resulting written plan will include smart investment recommendations to help you reach your financial goals and secure your retirement income. Learn more here.

name: Jim Kruzan
bio: Balancing the responsibilities of Founder and Senior Wealth Advisor puts Jim in a unique position at Kaydan Wealth Management. As the Founder, Jim is responsible for guiding the direction of the firm’s moral compass and ensuring the entire team is advancing its mission statement. As Senior Wealth Advisor, he manages the firm’s largest and most complex client relationships and is also hands-on with the development of comprehensive, process-driven wealth solutions. Learn more here.

name: Christine Timms
bio:
Christine Timms retired from a successful 33-year career as an investment advisor at career highs in both assets under management and annual revenue. She achieved her firm's top performance level for each of the last 24 years of her career. Christine credits much of her success to a constantly evolving business model, efficient processes and her strong team of seven professionals. She is now passing on lessons and tips she learned the hard way to help advisors focus, organize their practices, enhance their services and serve more clients. Learn more here.

Christine’s series of Handbooks for the Professional Financial Advisor includes:

Business Models for Financial Advisors

  • Develop and Articulate Your Unique Business Model

Team Building for Financial Advisors

  • Enhance Client Services, Grow Your Business and Improve Your life

Transitioning Clients and the Retirement Exit Decision

  • Includes Strategies and Tools for Seeking and Implementing Group Referrals.

All three books are available through Amazon in kindle and paperback. Transitioning Clients and Retirement Exit Decision is also available through Audible. Business Model templates are found here. Team Building templates are found here. Contact Christine through LinkedIn here or through www.christinetimms.com

name: True Life Capital
bio: True Life Capital (TLC) is a Denver-based company that seeks to repurpose urban infill real estate into residential development opportunities with a repeatable and effective process. TLC acts as a supply-chain provider to home builders in metro markets across the U.S., using data to identify infill properties with high potential, assuming control over those properties with purchase-and-sale agreements, entitling and designing site plans for new communities, and finally selling the shovel-ready parcels to builders. With offices in nine regions nationwide, TLC is on a mission to solve the supply/demand imbalance in the housing market for the next generation of home buyers. Lean more here.

name: Schwab Advisor Services
bio:
At Schwab Advisor Services™, we are dedicated to working with and learning from advisors like you. With 30 years of experience serving over 13,000 independent advisors, we understand what it takes to help you meet your business goals. That’s how we deliver the heightened level of support you need to take control of your destiny—and create the firm you want.

You can count on our custodial services and unmatched industry expertise to help propel you forward with:

  • - A foundation that frees you to focus on your clients
  • - Solutions and strategic guidance to help you grow your business
  • - Personalized and powerful insights.

Learn more here.

name: Richard Dri
bio: Since 2011, Richard has been a Portfolio Manager, Vice President and team leader of Dri Financial Group at Scotia Wealth Management. Richard is a Certified Financial Planner, a Chartered Investment Manager and an accredited Family Enterprise Advisor. Richard writes a weekly blog on total wealth planning, investment strategies and life topics. His current book, ‘Introduction to the Investment Mindset,’explains how  emotions can be the biggest threat to achieving financial freedom. Learn more here.

name: Alliance for Lifetime Income
bio: THE ALLIANCE FOR LIFETIME INCOME is a non-profit 501(c)(6) educational organization based in Washington, D.C., that creates awareness and educates Americans about the value and importance of having protected lifetime income in retirement. Our vision is for a country where no American has to face the prospect of running out of money in retirement. The Alliance provides consumers and financial professionals with educational resources, interactive tools, and actionable research and insights to use in building retirement income strategies and plans. Learn more here.

name: Michelle Gessner
bio: As a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professional, I am passionate about building a life plan for my clients and helping them see that they have choices, which often comes to them as a pleasant surprise. I am an independent thinker and a huge advocate of my clients’ interests. My greatest joy is working to do what is right for them and be their voice. As an avid problem solver with a penchant for learning, I love to challenge myself with a new goal each year. I view my role as requiring not just financial aptitude, but also a constant desire for personal and professional improvement. Teaching others is something that comes naturally to me, so you will often find me leading a retirement planning class at the local community college several times a year. I’m a big believer in partnering with my clients and ensuring that they are empowered to make their own important decisions, so I strive to speak in plain English and simplify complex information. Learn more here.

name: Brendan Frazier
bio: Brendan Frazier is the founder of Wired Planning, the host of The Human Side of Money podcast, a keynote speaker, and was named one of Investopedia’s Top 100 Financial Advisors. He’s also the creator of The Ultimate Discovery Meeting, where he teaches advisors a framework for seamlessly converting prospects into clients in one meeting. Follow Brendan on LinkedIn. Learn more here.

name: Nicole Romito
bio: I have built my entire career in the financial services industry as a trusted partner and sounding board for my clients. My clients feel safe sharing their dreams and fears about money and life. I help them manage their emotions around their wealth so they can tune out the noise that might get in the way of making financial decisions that are right for them and their loved ones. I focus on working with women in transition — divorce, widowed or retiring senior executives. Learn more here.

name: Kalli Fedusenko
bio: Over 10 years of experience in the financial planning industry and being formerly licensed with the series 7 & 63 provides Kalli an insight and understanding into your practice and objectives. She specializes in brand strategy, web content strategy, video content planning, and more. This powerful combination of creativity and strategy makes Kalli the perfect guide to give your brand a voice. Learn more here.

name: CircleBlack
bio: CircleBlack is unlocking the potential of the wealthtech ecosystem by delivering an interoperable all-in-one cloud-based software platform. CircleBlack’s platform includes performance reporting, rebalancing, and billing functionality, as well as real-time two-way connectivity to custodian and held away accounts along with a range of 3rd party CRM, planning, and risk tools. Over 100 advisory firms and 1,000 advisors leverage CircleBlack technology to deliver prosperity to families and communities. Learn more here.

name: Billy Peterson
bio: After more than 10 years as a winning quarter-horse jockey, Billy made the decision to pursue a brand new challenge: helping investors meet and exceed their short- and long-term financial objectives. As a financial planner, he works to connect with his clients professionally and personally. A graduate of the University of Texas at El Paso, Billy holds a Bachelor of Arts in business administration and finance. He has continued his education throughout his career. Billy’s financial services career began in 1996 in Long Beach, California, where he served as a senior vice president of investments with PaineWebber. He went on to serve as a senior vice president of wealth management with Morgan Stanley Smith Barney before pursuing independence in 2009 by opening his own financial services company, Peterson Wealth Services, Inc. Learn more here.

name: Ken New
bio: Ken New is committed to helping retirees and pre-retirees understand financial strategy. Since 1997, he has spent time discovering options for income planning with a definitive strategy to reduce taxes. Ken explains options for growth to clients that will raise the probability that they will not outlive their income. He has such a unique and wide range of expertise in the financial industry that he is a member of the prestigious Million Dollar Round Table and a past officer of the National Association of Insurance and Financial Planners. Ken is a resident of Viera, Florida and is happily married to his wife, Linda. He enjoys spending time with his wife, daughter, Lindsey and granddaughter, Adalyn. Learn more here.

name: Dave Zoller
bio: Dave Zoller is the co-owner of Streamline Financial, an advisory firm near Chicago. In an effort to grow their firm in 2019, Dave and his business partner, Tim, set out to test various advisor marketing methods. Fast-forward 18 months and they started getting 50 people reaching out to them for an intro call every month. As they continue to run their firm, they’re also sharing their marketing tactics, growth strategies, and practice management tips so that other advisors can succeed as well. Learn more here.

name: Financial Experts Network
bio: Over the last 10 years, Tom Dickson has hosted subject-matter experts on over 450 national webinars that have drawn over 150,000 financial advisors. 90% of attendees surveyed responded that they learned information and strategies that will help them better serve their clients. Most webinars provide CE credit for CFP, RICP, CLU and ChFC designations, as well as CE credit for NAPFA members and CPE for CPAs. Learn more here.

name: Shannon Spotswood
